#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk virt-install
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: virt-manager bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: Virtual Machine Manager (virt-manager) is a graphical tool for administering virtual machines for KVM, Xen, and Linux Containers (LXC). The virt-manager utility uses the libvirt API and can start, stop, add or remove virtualized devices, connect to a graphical or serial console, and view resource usage statistics for existing virtualized guests on local or remote machines. The virt-manager packages have been upgraded to upstream version 1.2.1, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1197254) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previously, when the user checked the "Copy host CPU information" option in virt-manager's "Configuration of Processor" menu during creation of a new guest, the guest failed to start and displayed a "host doesn’t support invariant TSC" error. With this update, virt-manager uses "host-model" mode when copying the host CPU configuration, which prevents the error. As a result, the guest now starts as expected in the described scenario. (BZ#1229163) Prior to this update, using the virt-clone utility to clone a guest to a path other than /var/lib/libvirt/images caused the disk in the created guest copy to be corrupted if the source disk was in a non-raw format. Now, virt-clone retains the disk format of the source and creates a disk copy with the correct format for any destination path, and the guest copy can thus be successfully started. (BZ#1207729) Changing the default guest name when creating a new guest in virt-manager previously caused the guest's disk name to be incorrectly based on the operating system rather than on the guest name. This update modifies virt-manager to properly obtain the name for the created virtual disk from the name of the guest. (BZ#1218278) Users of virt-manager are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
